column4: hi... what are my options if ubuntu doesnt pick up my hsync/vres correctly?
manually edit your xorg

IT is standard xga tft
Until you have some experience, stay with the repos.. or install a second copy of ubuntu on a different partition and play with that.. or have a second home partition to make reinstalls easier

YES
If you HAD, you would know generic vesa mode is 1024x768 and you would not be stuck at 800x600
I *CAN* load up 1024x768 except I'm missing about 1" of screen space. Let me look into this "generic vesa mode" and see if that IS the problem.
I looked through your FAQ yet again and there isn't anything relevant there that I haven't tried yet. Can you look into my problem instead of spamming FAQ links at me?
